meanings.sent1: The flower had an infundibular shape, narrowing towards the base.
meanings.sent2: The infundibular cloud formation looked like a giant funnel in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The infundibular hat made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her infundibular dress flowed elegantly as she walked, resembling a funnel in motion.
meanings.sent5: The infundibular design of the building's roof was both unique and functional.

meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling an infundibulum
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the infundibular structure of the brain to the students.
meanings.sent2: The infundibular connection between the two systems was crucial for their interaction.
meanings.sent3: The infundibular pattern on the fabric looked surprisingly stylish.
meanings.sent4: His infundibular explanation shed light on the complex topic.
meanings.sent5: The infundibular relationship between the characters added depth to the story.
